business.headline: Budget 2026: In a first, Nirmala Sitharaman to spotlight Part B as reform roadmapFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's ninth Union Budget marks a strategic shift by emphasising Part B to outline India's economic vision and reform agenda.

Big tax changes unlikely in Budget 2026. So what can you expect?With major tax relief already delivered last year and the economy stable, Budget 2026 is expected to offer only minor tweaks. The chances of a big income tax announcement remain slim.

EU deal a defining moment, India negotiates from position of strength: Piyush GoyalUnion Minister Piyush Goyal says India negotiated the EU free trade agreement from a position of strength, with the deal expected to open new markets and create millions of jobs in key sectors.

Why there's no buzz ahead of Budget 2026With tax reforms already delivered, inflation under control and the economy stable, Budget 2026 is expected to emphasise stability and long-term growth, which is why public expectations remain modest this year.

NSE, BSE to hold rare Sunday trading session for Budget 2026The National Stock Exchange and the Bombay Stock Exchange will conduct a full trading session, making this only the second instance since Independence that equity markets will operate on a Sunday.

Why Nike is relaunching its India online store with NykaaThe partnership has already sparked curiosity among Indian consumers and the retail industry, raising questions about why a global sportswear giant is handing a key piece of its digital business to an Indian online fashion retail platform.

Is AI boom really behind the sudden drop in global tech stocks?As high-priced software firms face tighter competition and slowing growth, is the recent plunge in global tech stocks truly an AI shock or just a correction catching up with fundamentals?

India's focus should be on education to compete with US and China: Jayant SinhaJayant Sinha said competing with the United States and China will require a budget that focuses on education, higher productivity and broader technological access.

How freebies bled Indian economy. Economic Survey suggests a Brazilian modelThe Economic Survey 2025-26 flags the unchecked rise of freebies provided by the state governments in India. It says they are draining public finances, widening deficits by leaving little money for investments in infrastructure and human capital. It argues that reforms are needed to the freebie culture, and urges policymakers to adopt outcome-linked, time-bound models like Brazil's Bolsa Familia.

Budget 2026: Trade deficit grew under UPA and NDA, pace slowed after 2014India's trade deficit widened under both UPA and NDA, but Economic Survey 2026 data shows the pace slowed after 2014 as import growth moderated, despite weaker export momentum.

ED arrests ex-Reliance Communication chief Punit Garg in Rs 40,000-crore fraud casePunit Garg served as President handling the company's Global Enterprise Business between 2006 and 2013, and later as President (Regulatory Affairs) from 2014 to 2017.

NSE IPO finally approved after 9 years: Here's all you need to knowWith Sebi's clearance in hand, NSE can now formally appoint merchant bankers and legal advisers to prepare its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP). Market estimates suggest the exchange could take around eight to nine months to launch the IPO.

Will Budget 2026 bring income tax relief? What salaried taxpayers can expectAhead of Budget 2026, one question dominates conversations among salaried taxpayers: will income tax relief finally come? Let's have a look.

From AI skilling to real jobs: What industry wants from Budget 2026India has no shortage of AI talent, but turning skills into sustainable jobs remains a challenge. Ahead of Budget 2026, industry leaders want policies that connect training, infrastructure and real-world deployment.
Sensex, Nifty pause winning rally as investors turn cautious ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 296.59 points lower at 82,269.78, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 98.25 points to end at 25,320.65.

8th Pay Commission: Will employees get arrears, and if yes, when?With January 2026 nearly over and no formal announcement yet, government employees are growing anxious about the 8th Pay Commission. The big question now is whether delayed salary revisions will lead to arrears, and when the money may actually reach their bank accounts.

Budget 2026: Building India's next-generation supply chainsContinued public investment in infrastructure remains the single most important driver of logistics efficiency. Budget 2026 presents an opportunity to further strengthen this momentum by deepening last-mile connectivity to industrial clusters, agri-production zones, and Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.

Silver prices slide after hitting record highs. Is it the right time to buy?Silver has finally cooled after a record-breaking rally. With prices stabilising and demand still strong, the real question is simple: will you use this dip to start buying?

Gold, silver ETFs tumble after record highs: Buy the dip or stay cautious?After a strong rally that pushed gold and silver to record levels, ETFs tracking the precious metals saw a steep fall on January 30. The sharp correction has sparked fresh questions about whether the dip is worth buying or if volatility may deepen further.

Budget 2026 should be an exporter's budget. Here's whyFrom tariff pressure to compliance hurdles, exporters are under strain. Budget 2026 needs to focus on easing these burdens so Indian businesses can protect market share and grow confidently this year.

entertainment.headline: Explained: How Dhurandhar led Flipperachi's FA9LA to a Guinness World Record Bahraini rapper Flipperachi's 2024 track 'FA9LA' secured a Guinness World Record following its inclusion in Aditya Dhar's 2025 film 'Dhurandhar'. This new honour has sparked international acclaim and renewed popularity despite the film's ban in Gulf nations.

Kichcha Sudeep marks 30 years in cinema, promises to work even harder Kannada star Kichcha Sudeep marked 30 years in the industry with a heartfelt message expressing thanks to fans, collaborators, and the Kannada film fraternity for their support and inspiration throughout his career.

I loved it: Akshay Kumar praises 'goddess of acting' Rani Mukerji in Mardaani 3 Akshay Kumar has voiced his support for Rani Mukerji and her latest film, 'Mardaani 3', through a social media post. His support comes as the film is experiencing increasing popularity at the box office across India.

Salman Khan on Battle of Galwan trolling: It's a Colonel's look, not a romantic one Salman Khan responded to the social media trolling over his look in Battle of Galwan teaser. The film is directed by Apoorva Lahia and also features Chitrangda Singh.

Kalpana Iyer reacts to viral Ramba Ho video, thanks Dhurandhar team for reviving it In an interview with India Today, veteran actor Kalpana Iyer spoke about her viral dance at a wedding. The actor expressed joy and gratitude about receiving so much love.

Valentine's special: Salman Khan's Tere Naam to re-release in theatres The 2003 romantic drama 'Tere Naam', starring Salman Khan, will return to theatres in India with a special re-release on February 27, 2026.

Border 2: Sunny Deol grooves, cuts cake amid film's roaring success. Watch Sunny Deol and the cast of Border 2* celebrate the film's success as it achieves record-breaking earnings just days after its Republic Day release.

Amaal Mallik backs AR Rahman's stance on industry bias but disagrees on communalism Amaal Mallik reacted to AR Rahman's comments about communal bias in the Hindi film industry. He emphasised that Rahman was trying to highlight a larger issue.

Home Alone star Macaulay Culkin mourns on-screen mother Catherine O'Hara Macaulay Culkin remembered his on-screen mother from Home Alone, the late actor Catherine O'Hara. Schidt's Creek co-creator Dan Levy also paid tribute to O'Hara.

Alia on online comments on marriage to Ranbir: The noise doesn't reach us Alia Bhatt dismissed the noise surrounding her relationship with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor. She opened up on how she and Ranbir deal with public scrutiny, memes and commentary about their marriage.

Ananya Panday-Lakshya lead Karan Johar's Chand Mera Dil. Check release date Karan Johar is backing a new film titled Chand Mera Dil, featuring Ananya Panday and Lakshya in lead roles. The film will be Ananya's second release after Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.
Thanks, but no thanks, Sunny Deol: Border 2 has a serious problem My father served in the Army, so I will always have a soft corner for Border. Sadly, Border 2 disappointed me.

Homi Adajania wraps Cocktail 2 with Shahid, Kriti and Rashmika: Feels special Shahid Kapoor, Rashmika Mandanna and Kriti Sanon wrapped up the shooting of Cocktail 2. The actors celebrated with director Homi Adajania after the shoot concluded.

Border 2 box office Day 8: Sunny Deol's film enters 2nd weekend, faces Mardaani 3 Sunny Deol's Border 2 witnessed a further dip on its eighth day of release. The film has so far earned Rs 257.50 crore at the box office.

Why Saurabh Shukla thinks strict 8-hour shifts don't work. Exclusive Veteran actor Saurabh Shukla addressed the demand for eight-hour work shifts in the Hindi film industry. In an exclusive interview, he also reacted to AR Rahman's remarks on the lack of work in Hindi cinema and spoke about why he has stepped away from directing.

Mardaani 3 box office day 1: Rani Mukerji's cop thriller opens at Rs 3.48 crore Rani Mukerji's thriller, Mardaani 3 collected Rs 3.48 crore on its opening day. In-spite of Rani's return as the fierce cop, Shivani Shivaji Roy, the film earned less than its prequel Mardaani 2.

Border 2: What happens when old-school emotion meets new-age audience 'Border' is truly Bollywood's Gen Z war drama. The first film opened in 1997, the year that marked Gen Z start, and 29 years later we have 'Border 2'. In Cinematic Saturday, we look at the original's legacy that continues to be debated, even as 'Border 2' manages what few sequels can – bring three generations under one roof.

Schitt's Creek and The Last of Us actor Catherine O'Hara dies at 71 Emmy-winning actor Catherine O'Hara, a towering presence in film and television comedy, died at 71. Her career spanned SCTV, Home Alone, The Last of Us and Schitt's Creek.

No special preparation: Margot Robbie on steamy scenes in Wuthering Heights Margot Robbie has addressed the buzz around the steamy scenes in Wuthering Heights, saying they required no special preparation and were treated like any other part of the film.

general news.headline: Trashy rumination: India dismisses PM Modi's Israel visit mention in Epstein filesIndia has responded to reports of an email message from the Epstein files that has a reference to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his visit to Israel.

Budget 2026: In a first, Nirmala Sitharaman to spotlight Part B as reform roadmapFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's ninth Union Budget marks a strategic shift by emphasising Part B to outline India's economic vision and reform agenda.

Ajit Pawar's wife Sunetra takes oath as Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister  Live UpdatesGovernor Acharya Devvrat administered the oath in the presence of Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde.

5th T20I Live: India give sixer-fest in TrivandrumIndia vs New Zealand Live score, 5th T20I IND (271/5 in 20 ov): Ishan Kishan's statement century, Suryakumar Yadav's blazing fifty and Hardik Pandya's handy knock help India to post a record target.

Are EWS candidates paying crores to secure NEET PG seats?An online educational guidance platform claimed that around 145 EWS-listed seats in deemed universities were reportedly taken by candidates who paid fee in crores. The claim prompted misuse of the EWS reservation quota and gave a hint at a possible scam in NEET PG seats.

Elena Rybakina gets sweet revenge over Aryna Sabalenka, lifts Australian Open crownAustralian Open 2026: Elena Rybakina won her maiden title at Melbourne Park after beating World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-setter on Saturday at the Rod Laver Arena. Sabalenka, meanwhile, lost back-to-back finals at Melbourne Park.

Who is Sunetra Pawar, Maharashtra's first woman Deputy CM?If her husband, Ajit Pawar, was Baramati's 'Dada', Sunetra was fondly called by the people simply as 'vahini' (sister-in-law in Marathi). As she makes history as the first woman Deputy Chief Minister of Maharashtra, the soft-spoken Sunetra Pawar will have her task cut out.

Photos of ex-Prince Andrew crouching over woman in new Epstein filesFormer prince Andrew, the brother of the UK's King Charles, is seen kneeling over a woman lying on the floor in the photos released by the US Justice Department linked to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
Thanks, but no thanks, Sunny Deol: Border 2 has a serious problemMy father served in the Army, so I will always have a soft corner for Border. Sadly, Border 2 disappointed me.

Can't hold head high: Pak PM admits seeking bailout from many countriesPakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif admitted the country had to seek bailouts from multiple nations to support an International Monetary Fund programme, saying such dependence comes at a cost of self-respect.

1 killed, 14 injured in blast near Iran's Bandar Abbas portThe reported explosion in Bandar Abbas comes amid heightened tensions between Tehran and Washington, following weeks of unrest in Iran and renewed Western concerns over the country's nuclear programme.

Why India-EU trade deal is mother of all setbacks for PakistanThe India-EU free trade agreement (FTA), years in the making, will give India broad market access to those sectors that have long fostered Pakistan's export success in Europe, especially textiles and apparel. Pakistan now seems to be feeling the heat and is in panic mode.

Watch: Astro Shux unveils an Indian heritage item he carried to spaceIn Part 2 of his "What is in my bag, but in space" series, astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla unveils an Indian heritage souvenir he carried beyond Earth. He calls it Vishwaroopam.

Has the Supreme Court become India's second classroom?Handcrafted ByOur Editors Bold education reforms promise equity and autonomy, but many never make it past courtrooms. From NEP pushback to UGC regulations under judicial stay, litigation has become routine. Is India announcing reforms faster than it is building consensus?

Played porn, turned up TV to mute cries: Teen raped by father for years exposes himA disturbing case from Gujarat reveals how a minor girl was sexually abused by her father after her mother was diagnosed with cancer.

Why there's no buzz ahead of Budget 2026With tax reforms already delivered, inflation under control and the economy stable, Budget 2026 is expected to emphasise stability and long-term growth, which is why public expectations remain modest this year.

In the age of dating apps, disabled and chronically ill Indians are still looking for loveMost of us carry long checklists before choosing a partner. For those already fighting their own battles, how easy is it to find companionship in 2026? Or do we simply assume that love comes last on their priority list?

On Saturday, she defeated Aryna Sabalenka in three sets to avenge her loss in the 2023 final.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 19 | Rise & Rifts: Justice Party's Power Plays & PitfallsWhile the North unified under Gandhi's call for Non-Cooperation, the Justice Party saw an opening in Madras. They boycotted the boycott, choosing to align with colonial levers rather than revolutionary lanterns.

As board exams near, so does loneliness for studentsWith board exams weeks away, study routines have intensified, and social lives have shrunk. Homes have grown quieter as pressure has mounted and expectations have sharpened. For many students, preparation has turned into isolation.

It says they are draining public finances, widening deficits by leaving little money for investments in infrastructure and human capital. sports.headline: In Sanju Samson's hometown, Ishan Kishan makes a statement with 42-ball hundred Ishan Kishan scored his spectacular maiden T20I century against New Zealand. His explosive innings boosts India's hopes ahead of the 2026 World Cup, raising expectations and sparking debates on team selection.

Fiery Suryakumar Yadav sends T20 World Cup warning with historic T20I record IND vs N: Suryakumar Yadav became the fastest batter to reach 3,000 runs in men's T20Is, achieving the feat in the fifth and final T20I against New Zealand in Trivandrum.

Sanju Samson's horror run continues, batter disappoints local crowd in Trivandrum IND vs NZ: Sanju Samson failed to impress at his home ground during the fifth T20I against New Zealand. The opening batter was dismissed for 6, leaving his large fanbase disappointed.

International Olympic Committee monitors India after T20 World Cup row: Report The 2026 T20 World Cup disco has put India's 2036 Olympic hosting ambitions under scrutiny, with the IOC unlikely to tolerate political tensions that risk boycotts by participating nations.

Kishan, Patel return for 5th T20I as India finalise World Cup preparation India made three changes to their playing XI for the final T20I against New Zealand. Captain Suryakumar Yadav opted to bat first to test bowlers under dew ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026.

Subtle over spectacle: Rybakina's calm celebration strikes a chord after win Australian Open: Elena Rybakina marked her maiden Australian Open title at Melbourne Park with a restrained celebration, offering only a quiet fist pump. On Saturday, she defeated Aryna Sabalenka in three sets to avenge her loss in the 2023 final.

Djokovic vs Alcaraz: Who is Rafael Nadal supporting in AUS Open final? Australian Open: Legendary Rafael Nadal will be happy if Novak Djokovic wins the Australian Open. Speaking ahead of the 2026 final, Nadal has explained what impresses him the most about Djokovic.

Giant-sized cut-out, fan from Qatar: Trivandrum turns up for Sanju Samson India vs New Zealand: A festival-like mood engulfed Thiruvananthapuram as a Rs 1.2 lakh giant cut-out, drummers and devoted fans, including one from Qatar, celebrated Sanju Samson's long-awaited homecoming.

Elena Rybakina gets sweet revenge over Aryna Sabalenka, lifts Australian Open crown Australian Open 2026: Elena Rybakina won her maiden title at Melbourne Park after beating World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka in a thrilling three-setter on Saturday at the Rod Laver Arena. Sabalenka, meanwhile, lost back-to-back finals at Melbourne Park.

5th T20I Live: India give sixer-fest in Trivandrum India vs New Zealand Live score, 5th T20I IND (271/5 in 20 ov): Ishan Kishan's statement century, Suryakumar Yadav's blazing fifty and Hardik Pandya's handy knock help India to post a record target.

Tilak Varma's last bid push for T20 World Cup, trains intensely with Mayank YadavTilak Varma has been training hard to be fully fit for the T20 World Cup after he missed the five-match T20I series against New Zealand. Tilak last played for India in the South Africa T20Is after which he played two Vijay Hazare Trophy matches.

India need to stick with Gautam Gambhir, split coaching confuses players: BavumaSplit coaching is not going to solve India's ongoing Test crisis, feels South Africa's Temba Bavuma. Bavuma believes that removing Gambhir from the Test job and giving it to someone else is not going to help the Indian team.

Premier League: Managerial fates on line as Spurs face City, Liverpool host NewcastleSuper Sunday turns the Premier League spotlight on managers, with pressure mounting as results shape narratives and futures. Tottenham's City test and Liverpool's Newcastle clash could redefine Thomas Frank and Arne Slot's seasons this weekend.

T20 World Cup: Pat Cummins ruled out, no Steve Smith in Australia's squadT20 World Cup: Australia have suffered a major setback going into the T20 World Cup captain. Senior fast bowler Pat Cummins has been ruled out of the tournament due to a back injury.

Women's Singles Final Highlights: Comeback queen Rybakina wins Australian OpenAustralian Open 2026 Highlights, Women's Singles final: Elena Rybakina has pulled off an incredible comeback win against Aryna Sabalenka. 0-3 down in the decider, Rybakina beats Sabalenka 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 to clinch her maiden Australian Open title.

Harry Brook makes U-turn on England nightclub row: Admits lying to protect teammatesHarry Brook admitted he lied about the Wellington nightclub incident to protect teammates. The U-turn comes amid wider scrutiny of England's off-field conduct following a bruising Ashes tour and disciplinary investigations.

An unbeaten juggernaut, invincible India stand ready to defend T20 World CupT20 cricket thrives on unpredictability, yet India have dominated the format since August 2023. The defending champions have won 49 of their 63 matches, losing just three, and remain unbeaten across bilateral series and multi-nation events. No team has won the men's T20 World Cup at home or defended the title, but this Indian side has the form and balance to challenge history.

U19 stars get pep talk from Sachin ahead of World Cup match against PakistanU19 World Cup: Ahead of India's Super 6 match against Pakistan, the Indian Cricket Board arranged a legendary pep talk session for the U19 team. Sachin Tendulkar spoke to the Indian kids ahead of their crucial fixture in the World Cup.

Game, set, marathons: Djokovic, Alcaraz power an epic 9-hour Australian Open bingeMelbourne Park was treated to a Friday for the ages as Novak Djokovic and Carlos Alcaraz delivered more than nine and a half hours of engrossing drama in the Australian Open semifinals. Djokovic outlasted Jannik Sinner to flaunt his seemingly bottomless reserves, while Alcaraz staged a remarkable comeback to shatter Alexander Zverev's title hopes.

Captain Suryakumar Yadav has the shadow of Rohit Sharma, deserves credit: Irfan PathanIrfan Pathan believes Suryakumar Yadav's captaincy impact is being overlooked despite India's dominant T20I run. With the World Cup nearing, India's skipper enters the final New Zealand game carrying results, momentum and belief.

Glory vs Revenge: Aryna Sabalenka faces Elena Rybakina in Melbourne showdownAustralian Open: World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka and and 2022 Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina are set to clash on Saturday in a thrilling rematch of the 2023 final at Melbourne Park, where Sabalenka came back from a set down to claim her maiden Grand Slam title.

Many experts wanted me to retire, thanks to them for motivation: Novak DjokovicNovak Djokovic hit back at retirement talk after beating Jannik Sinner in an epic Australian Open semi-final. The win sends the 38-year-old into a blockbuster final against Carlos Alcaraz in Melbourne.

Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta compares relationship with Pep Guardiola to Federer-NadalMikel Arteta likened his relationship with Pep Guardiola to the Federer-Nadal rivalry during the Premier League title race. Arsenal lead City by four points as Arteta insists respect survives fierce competition at the summit still.

5th T20I preview: Sanju Samson comes home with everything to proveIND vs NZ, 5th T20I Preview: With the T20 World Cup just days away, India's series finale against New Zealand is more than a formality. In Thiruvananthapuram, hometown hero Sanju Samson faces a vital test of form beneath the gaze of an expectant Greenfield crowd.

The Premier League Weekly: Bruno Fernandes weighs his future, Szoboszlai in demand?From contract talks and transfer plans to managerial decisions and survival fights, this week's Premier League column breaks down the key stories shaping clubs as the season heads into a decisive phase.

All-round Wareham helps Gujarat end Mumbai hoodoo, march into EliminatorGujarat Giants secured their first-ever victory over Mumbai Indians Women in Women's Premier League history to end their eight-match losing streak against the defending champions and booked their place in the Eliminator fixture.

Zverev's outburst over Carlos Alcaraz's medical timeout: But what do the rules say?Alexander Zverev raised a big issue over Carlos Alcaraz taking a medical time-out in the third set of the semifinal at the Australian Open. But, when it comes to treating cramps on court, the ATP and other Tennis organisations have clear-cut rules.

5th T20I predicted XI: Axar, Kishan in line to play, Hardik to be restedIndia look to end T20 series on a high in Thiruvananthapuram after losing the fourth T20I. The team management may be tempted to make a few changes with this being the last game ahead of T20 World Cup 2026.

Djokovic proves difficult was never impossible, overcomes his demons a.k.a SinnerAustralian Open 2026 semifinal: Written off by many, Novak Djokovic dug deep to defeat Jannik Sinner in a gripping Melbourne semifinal, turning doubt into belief in one of the Australian Open's great epics.

Spotlight, spin, scrutiny: Sanju Samson rehearses for Trivandrum homecoming India vs New Zealand, 5th T20I: Sanju Samson's return to the opening slot has yet to click, but in his hometown, on the eve of India's final T20I before the World Cup, the Kerala star fine-tuned his game in the nets. Ishan Kishan and captain Suryakumar Yadav also trained hard under lights on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
